summary: Transitive dependency vulnerability in ajv 5.5.2 (CVE-2020-15366) affecting the nyc-test-coverage package. A specially crafted JSON schema could enable code execution through prototype pollution in Ajv's validate() function.
userImpact: Users may be exposed to code execution risk if untrusted JSON schemas are validated using the affected transitive dependency.
rootCause: Prototype pollution vulnerability in ajv 5.5.2 allows arbitrary code execution when processing specially crafted JSON schemas.
proposedFix: Upgrade ajv to version 6.12.3 or later
resolutionDetails: The vulnerable library was removed from the Mend inventory or marked as ignored in the specific branch, resolving the security concern.
keyQuote: A carefully crafted JSON schema could be provided that allows execution of other code by prototype pollution.
